title: Shakespeare in 1606 and Olympic swimmers
itunes:title: Shakespeare in 1606 and Olympic swimmers
itunes:subtitle: Professor James Shapiro talks to us about his new book 1606: William Shakespeare and the Year of Lear, a follow-up to his acclaimed 1599. Meanwhile the author Julie Checkoway tells the story of a remarkable group of Japanese-American swimmers who sough...
description:
Professor James Shapiro talks to us about his new book 1606: William Shakespeare and the Year of Lear, a follow-up to his acclaimed 1599. Meanwhile the author Julie Checkoway tells the story of a remarkable group of Japanese-American swimmers who sought unlikely Olympic glory.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.
